intro: Ochthocosmus sessiliflorus, commonly known as the sessile-flower daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, daisy-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with a distinctive central disc. Ochthocosmus sessiliflorus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and dry landscapes.
